info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 6:42PM CST until December 16 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CST FOR BOURBON AND VERNON COUNTIES... At 640 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Blue Mound to near Redfield to near Uniontown, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. 65 MPH Wind gusts was reported in Moran KS and multiple trees down between Humboldt and Iola KS with winds estimated at 60 to 70 mph when the storms move through those locations. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Nevada... Fort Scott... Marmaton... Bronson... Uniontown... Walker... Bronaugh... Fulton... Redfield... Moundville... Richards... Milo... Mapleton... Deerfield... Metz... Stotesbury... Harding... Petersburg... Porterville... Xenia... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 79 and 107. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
